last_episode_to_air.name: A Brutal Outcome
last_episode_to_air.overview: Makueeyapee Whitford claims the murder he committed was an act of self-defense against a rival tribe, but eyewitness testimonies tell a different story.

name: I Am a Killer
overview: Death row inmates convicted of capital murder give a firsthand account of their crimes in this documentary series.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Murderers recount the true stories of their crimes, including a woman who killed her abusive husband and the man behind a deadly New Year's Eve party.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: While serving hard time for murder, inmates recount their crimes and reflect on how their actions destroyed lives — including their own.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: Premeditated deeds, tragic accidents or acts of self-defense? Murderers recount the harrowing crimes that landed them in prison with life sentences.

tagline: Ten killers. One last chance to be heard.

episodes.name: Means to an End
episodes.overview: After years in solitary confinement, James Robertson admits to murdering his new cellmate as an escape to the better conditions on death row.

episodes.name: Killer in the Eyes of the Law
episodes.overview: Kenneth Foster's death sentence is commuted just hours before his execution, but he asserts that his punishment under an unusual Texas law is unfair.

episodes.name: The Mockingbird
episodes.overview: Raised in an environment of drug addiction and crime, teenager Justin Dickens commits murder but disputes the prosecutor's version of events.

episodes.name: Sympathy for the Devil
episodes.overview: Sentenced for a triple murder linked by police to Satanism, Miguel Angel Martinez becomes the youngest person ever on death row in Texas.

episodes.name: Intended Evil
episodes.overview: After shooting his ex-girlfriend and her new lover, Charles Thompson is charged with manslaughter -- until his ex dies due to a hospital error.

episodes.name: Declared Competent
episodes.overview: No one -- including David Lewis himself -- disputes that he committed murder. But Lewis's mental fitness remains in doubt despite his death sentence.

episodes.name: Family Affair
episodes.overview: High on a drug that fuels his paranoia, Deandra Buchanan fatally shoots his aunt, stepfather and girlfriend -- a crime he claims he can't recall.

episodes.name: Hunted
episodes.overview: Robert Shafer and a friend target a same-sex couple in a robbery, but their crime spins out of control into kidnapping and double murder.

episodes.name: Living with the Consequences
episodes.overview: Teenage drug abuser Joshua Nelson murders a friend in cold blood to steal his car, but other shocking motivations for the crime emerge at his trial.

episodes.name: A Matter of Life and Death
episodes.overview: Convicted murderer Wayne Doty admits his guilt but requests that his execution be carried out by electric chair, a method no longer used in Florida.

episodes.name: In Her Hands
episodes.overview: Why did 32-year-old Lindsay Haugen strangle and kill her 25-year-old lover Robert Mast in a Wal-Mart parking lot in Billings, Montana, on the 15th of September 2015? Revenge? Financial gain? Vicious compulsion? Mercy? Curiosity…? Well, it all depends on who you ask.

episodes.name: An Ordinary Boy
episodes.overview: At the age of 17 years old, Leo Little kidnapped, robbed and murdered Jehovah’s Witness minister Christopher Chavez.

episodes.name: Pyro Joe
episodes.overview: After slashing the throat of 72-year-old Ruth Predmore when he went to rob her home to pay for his sister’s medical bills, Joseph Murphy spent 24 years on death row before finally having his sentence commuted by the then Governor of Ohio, John Kasich a week ahead of his scheduled execution.

episodes.name: Trapped
episodes.overview: On October 13th 1984, after 15 years in an unhappy marriage Linda was planning to demand a divorce and according to Linda Couch that night a fight broke out and a gun discharged accidently, shooting Walter in the back of the head, killing him.

episodes.name: Overkill
episodes.overview: In 1996, David Barnett murdered his adoptive grandparents, stabbing them over 20 times with five different knives. His motivation for doing so remained a mystery until it was discovered that David Barnett claimed to have been subjected to years of physical and sexual abuse, not by his grandparents but by their son, his adoptive father, John Barnett.

episodes.name: Crossing the Line
episodes.overview: Cavona Flenoy was convicted of the murder of a Sudanese student, with prosecutors arguing that she had lured him in with a promise of sex before shooting him and stealing his wallet and car.

episodes.name: Owning It
episodes.overview: Charles Armentrout attempted to murder his father, and successfully murdered his grandmother.

episodes.name: A Silent Order
episodes.overview: For two murders he had carried out on New Year’s Day in 1996, Hutchinson received the ultimate punishment.

episodes.name: Something Hideous
episodes.overview: In 1984, alongside two female accomplices, Toby Lynn Williams robbed and kidnapped at gunpoint his former employer, Johnny Moore, his wife, Deborah, and six-month-old baby.

episodes.name: Honorable Intentions
episodes.overview: In December 1996, Mark Sam Arthur discovered his friend’s mother – Carmen Fonseca – badly beaten, at the hands of her husband. Whilst comforting the abused woman, Mark says he resolved to avenge her should he ever get the chance.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: Murderers recount the true stories of their crimes, including a woman who killed her abusive husband and the man behind a deadly New Year's Eve party.

episodes.name: A Question of Loyalty
episodes.overview: Subjected to abuse throughout her life, Victoria Smith confessed to killing her husband. But someone close to the case has doubts about her admission.

episodes.name: Someone Else
episodes.overview: On death row for murder, Deryl Madison reflects on his struggles with mental illness and finds support from an anti-capital punishment advocate.

episodes.name: History Repeating
episodes.overview: Daniel Paulsrud says his fatal shooting of partner Leslie was an accident. But accounts from her family — and his handwritten notes — raise doubts.

episodes.name: Blackout
episodes.overview: James Walker claims he has no recollection of the 2001 murder he confessed to committing. An investigation into his traumatic past offers more context.

episodes.name: Rolling the Dice
episodes.overview: Accept a plea deal or go to trial? Three men receive radically different prison sentences for their roles in the fatal shooting of a cab driver.

episodes.name: A Bad Day
episodes.overview: David Cameron Keith recalls the day he took a young hostage before heading to an airport and killing the pilot who volunteered to take the child's place.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview: While serving hard time for murder, inmates recount their crimes and reflect on how their actions destroyed lives — including their own.

episodes.name: Family Matters
episodes.overview: A murderer recounts the crime that ended one life and ruined his own. Those affected, including a police officer and the victim's family, also speak.

episodes.name: A Mother's Love
episodes.overview: In prison for killing her husband, a woman details her past abuse and her turbulent marriage. Her mother also reflects on their strained relationship.

episodes.name: Serving Time
episodes.overview: Years after leaving the military, Toby Gregory claims his service and PTSD caused him to murder his wife, Inez. But Inez's family believes otherwise.

episodes.name: A Father's Shadow
episodes.overview: Enraged over his rebellious daughter's choice in men, an extremist father enlists his son in a terrifying plot of intimidation and murder.

episodes.name: The Bogeyman
episodes.overview: Sentenced to life without parole for Jason Johnson's horrific murder, Gary Black says he has no regrets, while Jason's family finds purpose in tragedy.

episodes.name: Friendly Fire
episodes.overview: After fatally shooting a coworker, Thomas "TJ" Schiffens maintains his innocence. But details surrounding the crime suggest TJ had a motive.

4.name: Season 4
4.overview: Premeditated deeds, tragic accidents or acts of self-defense? Murderers recount the harrowing crimes that landed them in prison with life sentences.

episodes.name: Redemption
episodes.overview: By helping his fellow inmates, Jamel Hatcher feels he's turned his life around — but not everyone believes his rehabilitation is genuine.

episodes.name: Lost Innocence
episodes.overview: Young love takes a dark turn when Ashley Morrison's plan to run away with her boyfriend, Christian Sims, results in the murder of his grandmother.

episodes.name: Lives Lost
episodes.overview: Higinio Gonzalez killed a store clerk during an armed robbery at the age of 16. He swears it was an accident, but one county attorney isn't so sure.

episodes.name: If Things Were Different
episodes.overview: Ezdeth Highley reflects on her murder conviction, her transition while being incarcerated and what she's learned during her ongoing 60-year sentence.

episodes.name: Loved to Death
episodes.overview: Convicted for killing his grandmother, Rex Groves insists he no longer holds murderous thoughts towards his family. But their trust isn't easily won.

episodes.name: A Brutal Outcome
episodes.overview: Makueeyapee Whitford claims the murder he committed was an act of self-defense against a rival tribe, but eyewitness testimonies tell a different story.
